content.description: Fantastic little slab route just to the left of Dog Days. Can be led with small cams(0,1 metolius, with a #3 or 4 at the top) however you place them where your hands would go. Better off as a top rope problem. Top is the crux. As for the rock, it is good minus some grainy stuff at the top (nothing a little traffic won't take care of).
content.protection: Top rope or run out lead on small cams. Build your own anchor or boulder it as a highball VB
content.location: South face of the rock. Walk off.

content.description: Excellent beginners lead! Cams .2 to 3 (singles) w/ 4 draws. Start as a layback. Crux is near the top.
content.protection: .2-3 (can use a #4 in the top horizontal) or just TR it.
content.location: South face to the right of Mr. Norman's (obvious layback crack).

content.description: Start on 2 good crimps with your left foot on a good nub. High step to your previous hand position and launch off to the crux, a small razor sharp crimp to good jugs. Over all good quality but needs a lil more traffic! Can be top roped, otherwise bring a pad or 2. We thought this was a fun lil slab!
content.protection: TR or pads... Build your own anchor off the good tree (cams are optional)
content.location: Left(west)side of the formation, next to a small cave. Walk off.
